content: >http://www.google.com/hostednews/canadianpress/article/ALeqM5iDqk-twZoj0hKMo80GiYiW9zpQGQ A Toronto businessman with connections to Iran has been arrested for trying to export 'transducers' for nuclear weapons production. He bought 10 of them from a Boston company and told them he intended to ship them to Abu Dhabi. They wisely must have informed homeland security, for, unless somebody drops hardware while being questioned, the teenagers manning Canadian Customs generally don't know much more than what day of the week it is and where they're going for dinner. Maybe the Iranians can get him a good lawyer, otherwise he should just resign himself to life in the slammer, he's in the maw of justis.

title: Canadian Busted Trying to Peddle Nukes
